roleset.name: quake (trembling sense)
roleset.note: QUAKE-V NOTES: Automatically created based on framefiles: tremble (40.6), falter (47.3), hand-checked by Kevin. Member of VNcls body_internal_states-40.6, modes_of_being_with_motion-47.3. (from quake.01-v)

example.name: quake-v: Transitive
example.text: He looked down and noticed that his hands were quaking.

roleset.name: natural disaster: earthquake
roleset.note: EARTHQUAKE-N NOTES: Added by Julia in a Natural Disaster roleset endeavor. (from earthquake.01-n)

roles.note: The "VSP" function tags on 'death/injury toll' and 'damages/cost' correspond to the RED cause relation.

example.name: earthquake-n: arg 2
example.text: Strike-slip faults tend to be oriented near vertically, resulting in an approximate width of 10 km within the brittle crust,[7] thus earthquakes with magnitudes much larger than 8 are not possible.

example.name: earthquake-n: arg1- plate mentioned
example.text: Southwestern British Columbia?s largest recorded earthquake is an example of a North American Plate earthquake.

example.name: earthquake-n: Illustrative of loc as arg1
example.text: The San Francisco earthquake of 1906 was a major earthquake that struck San Francisco and the coast of Northern California.

example.name: earthquake-n: Arg1 as PP
example.text: People on Sacramento Street watch smoke rise from the fires that followed the earthquake in San Francisco on April 18 1906.
